Play when an ally is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or when you take damage from a critical hit.

Until the end of your next turn, you enter a rage, with the following effects

  • You gain 2 additional damage to melee Strikes. If you have weapon specialization, this bonus increases to 4, or to 6 if you have greater weapon specialization.
  • You gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level.
  • You can't use concentrate actions unless they have the rage trait. You can still use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} while raging.

You can instead use the stats for your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Ah5g9pDwWF9b9VW9]{Rage} class feature if you have one. If you don't have the rage class feature, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} when the rage ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.CUrUXEqVVz57ZyM7]{Effect: Rage and Fury}

Play after making a successful melee attack.

You unleash a terrifying battle cry. Attempt an Intimidation check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} and compare the result against all enemies within 30 feet. You don't take a penalty if the enemies don't understand your language.

Play when you move into a space adjacent to a creature that is larger than you.

Move to the opposite side of that creature. This movement doesn't trigger any reactions based on movement.

Play at the start of your turn.

For the rest of your turn, you gain a climb Speed and a swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you make a horizontal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, increase the distance jumped by 10 feet.

The original Hero Point Deck has quite some disparity between the worst and the best cards, and while I don't claim to strike a perfect balance, I will try to bridge the gap between them. Some cards are situational and that's fine, to an extent, and as long as they are good in the situation they're designed for.

In order to use the patched cards, draw cards from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-tables.RollTable.R0J4qmkLgSBVkoYS]{Hero Point Deck (Patched + Expanded)} table.

Foundry Usage Note: Effect items for these patched cards have an asterisk (*) symbol appended to their name, as to differentiate them from the system's effects while searching the compendium.

A summary of each balance patch.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.Q0VHx9WidEcJkZhB]{Rage and Fury}

    • Changed its effects to take place immediately instead of at the start of your next turn, and the duration is now "until the end of your next turn".
    • Additional damage now scales with weapon specialization and greater weapon specialization (increases to 4 and 6 respectively).
    • Added temporary Hit Points equal to your level.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.yYRj0xk5LrymY4HH]{Battle Cry}

    • You don't take a penalty if the enemies don't understand your language.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.Gu6CHAPMigpV9awj]{Tumble Through}

    • Change the trigger line to "Play when you move into a space adjacent to a creature that is larger than you.", allowing the card to be played during a move action, instead of just after.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.D6hqfmZUksRvqNFR]{Fluid Motion}

    • Increase the climb and swim Speeds to be equal to your Speed rather than half.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.PBNU6dVJzZ4Sy8oG]{Hasty Block}

    • Update the feat to not require a shield and instead use an improvised object as a shield, using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield} spell as a basis.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.Ttn2H0JHJVksChGi]{Healing Prayer}

    • Tweak the scaling of the healing to progress more steadily across levels. It starts as 2d8 + 2 and increases by 1d8 + 2 at 3rd level and every two levels thereafter.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.gX1rPa5d4HZZ7PjW]{Channel Life Force}

    • You no longer become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} after using the regained focus point.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-journals.JournalEntry.gI02DMKytCyoYRZk.JournalEntryPage.niWQLhQk5wbHhjM7]{Flash of Insight}

    • You gain information as though you had succeeded in Recall Knowledge. If the check is too difficult for you to actually succeed, you gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.1Bt7uCW2WI4sM84P]{Dubious Knowledge} information instead.

Play during your turn.

Select yourself or an ally within reach. The target regains @Damage[((ceil(@actor.level / 2) + 1)d8+2*ceil(@actor.level / 2))[healing]] Hit Points. At 3rd level, and every two levels thereafter, increase the healing by an additional 1d8 + 2.

Play on your turn after you have spent all of your Focus Points.

Gain 1 Focus Point that must be spent by the end of your turn or it's lost.

Play when you are hit by a physical attack.

You wield an object as though it were a shield, drawing it if necessary, and you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} with it. This improvised shield has the hardness of an appropriately heightened @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield} spell. If the drawn object is a shield, you can use its statistics instead.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.9K44WMpCef0qtPU6]{Effect: Hasty Block}

After blocking in this way with a non-shield object, instead of using normal material statistics, roll a @Check[flat|dc:10|showDC:all]. On a failure, the object is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken} (but not destroyed).

Play at any time

You gain information as if you had successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recalled Knowledge} about a topic. If you could only succeed on a Recall Knowledge attempt about the topic with a natural 20, or if you could not have succeeded at all, you instead gain information as if you had failed while having @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.1Bt7uCW2WI4sM84P]{Dubious Knowledge}.
